abstract: The Deal Professor looks at the problems Oracle is having in Europe with its acquisition of Sun Microsystems and why this is a time when the regulatory covenants section of an acquisition agreement matter.
snippet: The Deal Professor looks at the problems Oracle is having in Europe with its acquisition of Sun Microsystems and why this is a time when the regulatory covenants section of an acquisition agreement matter.
lead_paragraph: The European Union‘s competition commission is busy reviewing Oracle’s acquisition of Sun Microsystems and has said it may not rule until Jan. 19, 2010. Sun is not doing well in the meantime, and this week it announced it would lay off up to 3,000 workers. Sun’s stock price is also rapidly imploding in light of the failure of progress in the Oracle acquisition and from Sun’s own difficulties.

headline.main: Weak Points of Sun Deal Come Out in Europe
